title.narrative: COnsolidating Sea Turtle conservation in the Azores (COSTA)

description.narrative: The recipient will assess loggerhead bycatch on longline vessels operating in Azorean waters by placing two observers on each of 2 LL vessels during two four month periods (Aug-Sep to Nov-Dec 2015 and Mar-Apr to June-July 2016 and analyze with previously collected bycatch data); restructure the turtle tagging activities in cooperation with local partners and expand tagging program with new partners; and develop a best practices nformation sheet in consultation with NMFS and USFWS for handling hooked or entangled turtles and to be distributed to LL fisherman that dock at Faial and Sao Miguel.

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Resource Management
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Resource Management

title.narrative: Turtles, beaches and villages on Boavista: Protecting sea turtles and nesting beaches, getting local people involved

description.narrative: The recipient will set up two field camps and one field station for patrols and monitoring of Norte, Canto, Boa Esperanca, Aqua Doce, , Cural Velho, and Santa Monica beaches to protect nesting loggerheads and nests throughout the nesting season; conduct education outreach in local schools, summer camps for youth, beach cleanups, and a training workshop for production of handcrafts from plastic waste.

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

transaction.usg:treasury-account: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund
U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund

title.narrative: Consolidating Sea Turtle conservation in the Azores 2 (COSTA2)

description.narrative: The recipient will assess loggerhead bycatch on longline vessels operating in Azorean waters by placing two observers on 2 LL vessels for 12 months and analyze data with previously collected bycatch data); restructure the turtle tagging activities in cooperation with local partners and expand tagging program with new partners; and continue to distribute a best practices nformation sheet to LL fisherman.

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

title.narrative: Joining forces to protect the endangered loggerhead sea turtles of Boavista.

description.narrative: The recipient will set up two field camps and one field station for patrols and monitoring of Norte, Canto, Boa Esperanca, Aqua Doce, , Cural Velho, and Santa Monica beaches to protect nesting loggerheads and nests throughout the nesting season; conduct education outreach in local schools, summer camps for youth, beach cleanups, and community develpment activities developed in consutation and coordination with Natura 2000 and BiosCV. The USFWS will work closely with grantee in setting goals, priorities, and developing budgets, and will provide assistance as needed and requested in engaging with National Governmental and other institutions to improve collaboration and conservation outcomes. USFWS will also provide assistance as necessary to ensure effective collaboration and cooperation between all MTCA grant recipients working within Cape Verde.

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

title.narrative: COnsolidating Sea Turtle conservation in the Azores 3 (COSTA 3)

description.narrative: The recipient will assess loggerhead bycatch on longline vessels operating in Azorean waters by placing two observers on 2 LL vessels for 12 months and analyze data with previously collected bycatch data); restructure the turtle tagging activities in cooperation with local partners and expand tagging program with new partners; and continue to distribute a best practices information sheet to LL fisherman.

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, Multinational Species Conservation Fund

title.narrative: COnsolidating Sea Turtle conservation in the Azores 4 (COSTA 4)

description.narrative: The purpose of the project is to collaborate with fisherman and the Azores Regional Directorate of Marine Affairs to protect and recover the NW Atlantic loggerhead nesting population. This nesting population is the largest loggerhead population in the world and nests primarily in the SE U.S with lesser nesting in Mexico, Bahamas, and Cuba. Hatchlings from nesting beaches passively migrate to the Eastern Atlantic on the Florida current where they spend several years as juveniles before migrating by to NW Atlantic coastal waters. The Azores is a particularly important foraging grounds for juvenile loggerheads where they interact with long line fisheries operations and experience accidental capture causing injury and mortality. The intent of this project is to reduce mortality of loggerheads from LL fisheries. Activities include: 1) placing two observers on LL fishing vessels for 12 months to collect additional bycatch data; 2) analyze these data and previously collected bycatch data to identify critical interaction zones; 3) restructure the turtle tagging activities in cooperation with local partners and expand tagging program with new partners; and 4) promote best practices for safe handling and release of accidentally captured turtles by LL fisherman through training workshops and brochures.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: William Jones; Colleen Holland; Julie Rice; Ry

title.narrative: Consolidating Sea Turtle conservation in the Azores (Costa 4).

description.narrative: The long-term goals of the project are to ensure the inclusion of sea turtles, and loggerhead sea turtles in particular, into the ongoing development of a marine strategy for the region by providing the necessary scientific instruments, and concurrently, with the stimulation and consolidation of longstanding scientific programs, contribute to the local awareness for the conservation of these species.

title.narrative: CONSOLIDATING SEA TURTLE CONSERVATION IN THE AZORES 5 (COSTA5)

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to collaborate with long line fisherman and the Azores Regional Directorate of Marine Affairs to minimize the impacts of fisheries bycatch on the large juvenile loggerhead foraging population in in the Azores. Activities include: 1) placing two observers on LL fishing vessels for 12 months to collect additional bycatch data; 2) analyzing these data and previously collected bycatch data to identify critical interaction zones; 3) restructure the turtle tagging activities in cooperation with local partners and expand tagging program with new partners; and 4) promote best practices for safe handling and release of accidentally captured turtles by LL fisherman through training workshops and brochures.
